itemDescription: English magician, intelligence officer, short story writer and radio broadcaster.

wikipedia_page.main: Leslie Harrison Lambert (11 November 1883 – 13 December 1941), known in public as A. J. Alan, was an English magician, intelligence officer, short story writer and radio broadcaster.  At the beginning of World War II he worked in naval intelligence at Bletchley Park.

response: Now free, Thomas Humber got the backing of Nottingham lace bleacher dyer and finisher, T Harrison Lambert, and took charge of the whole business and its Beeston works. Lambert, father of A. J. Alan, was a cycle-racing friend building a reputation as a successful company promoter. Humber and Lambert opened a factory in Coventry in 1886.A History of the County of Warwick, Volume 8, The City of Coventry, VCH, London, 1969
* A. J. Alan, English magician, intelligence officer, short story writer and radio broadcaster
